BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
 
 Running "docker build ." with current Dockerfile fails because of headers problem, see in error message.
 I think the problem is in python image version, which uses latest (therefore 3.8 for now) instead of python 3.6 as stated in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts/blob/master/README.md>README</denchmark-link>
 .
 I fixed this by changing first line of Dockerfile to "FROM python:3.6.5" and it works as expected.
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 
 git clone https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts.git
 cd gluon-ts
 git checkout v0.4.2
 docker build .
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Error Message</denchmark-h>
 
 <denchmark-code>gcc -pthread -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -fPIC -Iast27/Include -I/usr/local/include/python3.8 -c ast27/Parser/acceler.c -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.8/ast27/Parser/acceler.o
     ast27/Parser/acceler.c:13:10: fatal error: pgenheaders.h: No such file or directory
      #include "pgenheaders.h"
               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     compilation terminated.
     error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Full error log: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts/files/4023832/gluon-docker-err.log>gluon-docker-err.log</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Operating system: Ubuntu 18 on x86_64
 Python version: 3.8
 GluonTS version: 0.4.2
 Docker version:  18.09.7, build 2d0083d
 
 p.s.1 Sorry for any mistakes, this is my first issue on GitHub open source project :)
 p.s.2 Hope I can also fix this issue (once approved it's a real problem?) with a pull request later.
 p.s.3 You did a great job with this project so thanks!

comments_0.comment_text:
Thanks! This is consistent with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts/issues/446>#446</denchmark-link>
 
 Looking forward for a pull request :)
